p: 5-(Perylen-3-ylethynyl)uridine (IV). One portion of saturated aqueous K 2CO 3 (2 mL) was added to compound ( VIII) solution (250 mg, 0.34 mmol) in pyridine (2 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred for 10 h at 45°C and diluted with water (2 mL). The precipitate was filtered off, washed three times (water 5 mL, ethanol 2 mL, diethyl ether 5 mL), and dried in a vacuum to yield product ( IV) (151 mg, 85%) as a brown powder.
